questions.question: Which statement about physical data independence is TRUE?
options: Changes to indexes require application changes
Changes in file organization do not affect logical schema
It ensures logical schema remains unchanged forever

questions.question: In a weak entity, the primary key is formed using:
options: Combination of foreign key and partial key

questions.question: Which of the following violates 2NF?
options: Non-key attribute depends on entire composite key
Non-key attribute depends on part of composite key

questions.question: A table is in BCNF only if:
options: Every determinant is a candidate key
Every non-key depends on primary key

questions.question: Which relational algebra expression returns rows where A exists but not in B?
Which operation in relational algebra increases both number of columns and rows?
Which join condition may accidentally drop matching rows if column names differ?
In MySQL, TRUNCATE fails when:
options: Table has a foreign key referencing it

questions.question: Which constraint cannot be enforced at column level in MySQL?
AUTO_INCREMENT in MySQL increments even if:
options: INSERT fails due to duplicate key

questions.question: Which MySQL client supports JavaScript execution and AdminAPI?
Which SQL query correctly finds departments with more than 3 employees AND avg salary > 50000?
options: SELECT dept_id FROM emp WHERE COUNT(*)>3 AND AVG(sal)>50000;
SELECT dept_id FROM emp GROUP BY dept_id HAVING COUNT(*)>3 AND AVG(sal)>50000;
SELECT dept_id FROM emp HAVING COUNT(*)>3;
SELECT dept_id FROM emp GROUP BY dept_id WHERE AVG(sal)>50000;

questions.question: Which of the following subqueries MUST be correlated?
options: Subquery comparing row values of outer query

questions.question: EXISTS differs from IN because:
options: EXISTS compares values, IN compares rows
IN stops after first match, EXISTS checks all rows
EXISTS stops after first match, IN compares all values

questions.question: Which SQL clause is executed first when GROUP BY and WHERE exist?
Which normal form prevents dependency A → B when A is not a key?
Which is TRUE about OUTER JOIN behavior?
options: Left join removes unmatched left rows
Right join includes unmatched right rows with NULLs
Full join removes unmatched rows entirely
Inner join behaves same as full join

questions.question: Which relational algebra operation is used to implement DISTINCT?
A multivalued dependency X →→ Y exists when:
options: Y depends only on primary key
Y is independent of other attributes but depends on X

questions.question: Which MySQL datatype is best for storing monetary values?
Which SQL statement is guaranteed to copy indexes as well?
options: CREATE TABLE new AS SELECT * FROM old
INSERT INTO new SELECT * FROM old

questions.question: Which command produces empty table with structure only but WITHOUT indexes?
options: CREATE TABLE new AS SELECT * FROM old WHERE 1=0
INSERT INTO new SELECT * FROM old WHERE 1=0

questions.question: Which operator cannot be used directly with aggregate functions?
Which SQL result occurs when comparing NULL with any value using = ?
Which join may produce duplicate columns in result?
Which type of ERD constraint guarantees that a weak entity cannot exist without strong entity?
A relation with repeating groups violates:
Which SQL fragment is least efficient on large datasets?
Which of the following makes a view non-updatable?
Which relational algebra operator cannot be implemented using SQL DISTINCT?
A table with a transitive dependency violates:
Which MySQL engine supports foreign key constraints?
Which combination is allowed in DCL?
Which SQL statement finds employees whose salary is greater than ALL salaries in dept 10?
options: SELECT * FROM emp WHERE sal > ANY (SELECT sal FROM emp WHERE dept=10);
SELECT * FROM emp WHERE sal > ALL (SELECT sal FROM emp WHERE dept=10);
SELECT * FROM emp WHERE sal = ALL (SELECT sal FROM emp WHERE dept=10);
SELECT * FROM emp WHERE sal NOT IN (SELECT sal FROM emp WHERE dept=10);

questions.question: MINUS in relational algebra is equivalent to which SQL logic?
Which changes occur when TRUNCATE is executed?
Which join returns unmatched rows from both tables?
Which SQL statement detects employees who do NOT belong to any department?
options: SELECT * FROM emp e WHERE dept_id IN dept;
SELECT * FROM emp e WHERE dept_id NOT EXISTS;
SELECT * FROM emp e WHERE NOT EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM dept d WHERE d.id = e.dept_id);
SELECT * FROM emp e WHERE dept_id = NULL;

questions.question: Which feature does NOT belong to conceptual data model?
Which approach ensures both constraints and data are copied when duplicating a table?
options: CREATE TABLE new AS SELECT * FROM old;
CREATE TABLE new LIKE old; INSERT INTO new SELECT * FROM old;
INSERT INTO new SELECT * FROM old;
ALTER TABLE old RENAME TO new;
